title: Couple quit jobs to travel US in a van with their pet dog
text:
Share this article Share The van features a kitchen, an all-in-one living room and a bedroom, as well as plenty of storage space for their stripped-back lifestyle Cosy: By adding cushions, a coffee machine and guitars, the pair have a lot of home comforts in their motorhome Before their trip they spent four months tirelessly refurbishing the van's shell into a fully functional home, all while holding down full time jobs Converting their Dodge Sprinter van into a mobile home for themselves and their beloved pet dog cost $5,000. The empty shell before the refurbishment (left) and after its transformation (right) The couple installed two bench seats at the back of the van with storage underneath (right). The seats can then fold out into a double bed The pair decided to name their van Sonder. The inside area is just 100-square feet Living the dream: On their blog they reveal that two years ago they skipped college classes to go backpacking around Southeast Asia and 'realised how naturally the nomadic lifestyle came to' them The adventurous duo has over 8,500 Instagram followers on their Always the Road Instagram account and run a blog to inspire others interested in a life on the road On their Instagram account Taylor gave an insight into their lifestyle by explaining it can be hard to find a cheap or free place to park and that while people do offer them their driveaways they wish they could afford to stay at the beach, but this can cost $50 a night One of the family: Snoop likes to join the couple at the dinner table when they dine During their travels Mr Thuli teaches surf lessons. Before setting off he completed a business degree Home on wheels: Their American odyssey began after they completed senior year and still continues Share or comment on this article 
Get a job ffs
